results.title: The Dismissal
results.creator_credit: Kennedy-Miller, Terry Hayes, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.brief_description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Kennedy-Miller, Terry Hayes, George Miller, Phil Noyce, George Ogilvie, Carl Schultz and John Power
results.description: A fictional account of the events that led up to the decision, made by Sir John Kerr, to sack Gough Whitlam as Prime Minister and appoint Malcolm Fraser in his place. The events covered occurred over the period between 1972 and 1975 and have been arranged, in the film, into six parts. Cast: Peter Carroll, Bill Hunter, John Hargreaves, John Meillon, Max Phipps, John Stanton, Arthur Dignam, Ruth Cracknell, Nancy Hayes.

results.title: The Dish [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Working Dog, Robert Hirsch, Santo Cilauro, Tom Gleisner, Jane Kennedy and Rob Sitch
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, ‘The Dish’ tells the story of the first landing on the moon and the role a bunch of technicians in remote Australia played in delivering those images to the world. In stark contrast to images we’ve seen before in films and the news of NASA control rooms - hundreds of experts working around the clock to ensure a successful mission - the film segues to the activities of staff in the sleepy remote town of Parkes, South Australia, where the equal task of tracking the lunar module was shared with NASA. After we witness the Australian’s low-key approach to this responsibility what is revealed in this gentle comedy is a cultural critique; a celebration of the unique qualities that make us Australian and defines our cultural values.

results.title: The Discreet charm of the bourgeoisie
results.creator_credit: Greenwich Film Production Paris, Serge Silberman and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: The efforts of a group of friends to dine together are continually frustrated in this often hilarious surrealistic fable. As if in a dream, things go awry for all the characters in this, Luis Bunuel’s deliciously comical and brilliantly performed masterpiece. Co-written by Bunuel and Jean-Claude Carriere. English subtitles.

results.title: The Discovery of television
results.creator_credit: JBM Productions, BBC-TV, Alasdair Milne and John Lloyd
results.brief_description: The discovery and development of television is not the story of the efforts of a single person, but of many people. It is a search through a tangled web of scientific discoveries, inventions, and developments, of ideas tried and rejected and tried again, culminating with the efforts of an enthusiastic team of professionals led by Sir Isaac Shoenberg. Describes the early experiments in television leading to the first regular broadcasts from London beginning on 2nd November 1936. The work of the pioneers is reconstructed using contemporary records and interviews.

results.title: The Discovery of radium
results.creator_credit: CBS TV America, James Fonda and Bernard Girard
results.brief_description: Henri Becquerel a French scientist while studying uranium discovers properties hitherto unknown to the scientific world. The substance emitted rays that could penetrate black paper and leave an impression on a sensitive photographic plate. Pierre Curie and his wife Marie discover the unknown element, radio-active radium. The significance of their discovery was realised and the novelist Jules Verne considers that the possible results of the Curie’s work could be fantastic. He remarks that it is God’s glory to make a secret of things - man’s glory to uncover them. Presented by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Discovery of insulin
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: Here is the inspiring story of how, in July, 1921, in a little-used laboratory at the University of Toronto, two young Canadians, Frederick Banting and Charles Best, discovered insulin. Their work gave the hope of life and health to the world’s millions of diabetics. (An abridged version of The Quest)

results.title: The Discoverers
results.brief_description: A look at several scientific discoveries and techniques and their implications for the future of humanity - the laser, the fuel cell, urethane foam, the petrochemicals, cross-pollination of technologies, a jet piercing drill and micro-circuitry.

results.title: The Disco years
results.creator_credit: RLK Productions, Robert Lee King, John Peter James and Richard Hoffman
results.brief_description: Tom is in his final year of High School, desperately fighting against his attraction for the athletic Matt. In the overtly homophobic environment of school there is no-one Tom can talk to about his sexuality. Except, maybe, for the new teacher Mr. Reece? This bittersweet short film is a very funny and very poignant story about coming out as gay in the late seventies, in the disco years, where liberation began on the dancefloor. With Matt Nolan and Dennis Christopher.

results.title: The Dirty dozen
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Kenneth Hyman and Robert Aldrich
results.brief_description: A tough U.S. Army Major trains a violent group of criminals for one of the most bizarre and difficult combat assignments - a suicide mission! Their task is to infilitrate a protected German retreat, a chateau in occupied France, where the upper echelon of Generals relax. Getting in and staying alive will not be easy and the action is relentless in this extraordinarly explosive suspense film. The all-star cast includes Lee Marvin, Charles Bronson, Jim Brown, Telly Savalas, Trini Lopez, Donald Sutherland, Ernest Borgnine, Richard Jaeckel, George Kennedy, Ralph Meeker and Robert Ryan.
